title: 113_s2005
content: The Act titled "Consumer Learning through Electronically-Accessible and Reasonable Cost Information Act of 2013" or "CLEAR Cost Information Act of 2013" requires reporting of certain hospital payment data. The Social Security Act is being amended to include new subparagraphs related to hospital payment data reporting requirements. The Social Security Act is being amended to include new reporting requirements for subsection (d) hospitals to submit payment data to the Secretary for uninsured and insured patients over the past 2 years for common procedures. The Secretary determines payment data reporting for hospitals under the Social Security Act. Transparency is required for public access to data on hospital collections and policies, allowing for comparisons by zip code and consumer understanding. Hospitals must link to this data on their websites. The amendments made by this section require hospitals to include a link to payment data on their websites. Effective date applies to contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act. The Act mandates that MedPAC's annual reports to Congress include data on the percentage of charity care provided by hospitals. Additionally, a report on charity care trends from certain hospitals must be made publicly available. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act now requires the Secretary of the Treasury to post hospital data on a publicly accessible website for consumer comparison by zip code. Additionally, hospitals must provide a link to this data on their homepage as per Medicare requirements. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act mandates hospitals to include a link on their website to data posted under section 9007(e)(2)(C) for consumer comparison by zip code. Effective for contracts entered into or renewed after the Act's enactment date.
